page.title: 14Pishiobury Park.
page.content: {Pishiobury Park}covers nearly 250 acres.Pishiobury House ,which is a mansion,stands in it.It is made of mellowed brick and is set beside a lake and approached by an avenue nearly a mile long.It contains some wall-panelling and other fittings from the Elizabethan manor house which was destroyed by fire.The drive now has large houses on either side. All the houses back onto Pishiobury Park.Pishiobury Park also backs on to the main road,East Park,Pishiobury Drive and Beech Drive.The cows grazing in the park sometimes lean over the barbed wire fence and eat the vegetables which people grow.A farmer rents the land from the Hertfordshire County Council and lets the cows roam about in it.People walk through the park to the towpath beside the River Stort.
